serendipity: The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way
ephemeral: Lasting for a very short time
mellifluous: Sweet or musical; pleasant to hear
ethereal: Extremely delicate and light in a way that seems not to be of this world
resilient: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions
paradigm: A typical example or pattern of something
eloquent: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing
benevolent: Kind, generous, and caring about others
enigmatic: Difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious
tenacious: Tending to keep a firm hold of something; persistent
euphoria: A feeling or state of intense excitement and happiness
altruistic: Showing a selfless concern for the well-being of others
pragmatic: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically
esoteric: Intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people
verbose: Using or containing more words than needed
ambivalent: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas
meticulous: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
quintessential: Representing the most perfect or typical example of something
